p: The pharmacological effects of Salvia essential oils are based on the presence of more than 100 active compounds, which can be categorized into monoterpene hydrocarbons, oxygenated monoterpenes, sesquiterpene hydrocarbons, diterpenes, nonisoprenoid compounds and oxygenated sesquiterpenes [ 277, 278]. The most abundant components are 1,8-cineole, camphor, and a wide variety of thujenes [ 279].
